author: Brent Kendall
title: Supreme Court Denies Bid to Keep GOP-Friendly Districts in Pennsylvania
text:
The Supreme Court declined to block a ruling declaring Pennsylvania's existing congressional map unlawfully gerrymandered, clearing the way for new districts in this year’s midterm elections that boosts Democrats’ efforts to retake the U.S. House.

Justice Samuel Alito, without comment, denied a request by state Republican lawmakers to stay a Jan. 22 ruling by the Pennsylvania Supreme Court that invalidated the district lines the GOP majority drew in 2011 after the last census. In a divided ruling, the state’s high court found... RELATED VIDEO Is Extreme Gerrymandering Unconstitutional? A ​Supreme Court case on gerrymandering — the practice of drawing district boundaries for political advantage — could reshape the country’s political landscape. Critics say the partisan redistricting undermines representative democracy. Video/Photo: Madeline Marshall/WSJ.
